title: Script font for ID
content:
Anyone recognize this script font? I am trying to ID it, without much luck so far….

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [font1.gif](http://web.archive.org/system/files?file=font1.gif) | 3.04 KB |
author: lherrou

comments.content:
No, I thought that at first, but the q’s in Zapfino are wrong.

Here’s a better version…

 ![](http://web.archive.org/system/files?file=font_s1.jpg)

It looks like the ‘q’ from Zapfino one, altered slightly. The ‘x’ is also altered from Zapfino one.

- Lex

I thought maybe this was an example of Linotype’s new [Zapfino Extra](http://web.archive.org/web/20060110043636/http:/www.linotype.com/8-36-8-17894/standardglyphstheiralternates.html), with all the alternates and OpenType bells & whistles. However, that ‘q’ still doesn’t quite match up … I think Lex is right about the slight customization.

I agree with Lex too. The tail of the Zapfino One ‘q’ has just been clipped off. See the whole family of Zapfinos, including Forte, in the [Script Font ID Guide, Part 4](http://web.archive.org/web/20060110043636/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/Script04Pg13.html).

- Mike Yanega
